meanings.definition: a system of rules or principles governing behavior
meanings.sent1: In our school, the dispensations for student conduct are clearly outlined in the handbook.
meanings.sent2: The dispensations for parking are displayed on the signs in the parking lot.
meanings.sent3: During the game, the referee's dispensations on fair play were taken very seriously by the players.
meanings.sent4: The dispensations of honesty and integrity are the foundation of a strong community.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the dispensations of the road can prevent accidents and keep everyone safe.

meanings.definition: the act of distributing or giving out something
meanings.sent1: The dispensations of food to the homeless are done with kindness and compassion.
meanings.sent2: The dispensations of prizes at the event brought smiles to the winners' faces.
meanings.sent3: The dispensations of candy at Halloween made the children very happy.
meanings.sent4: Her dispensations of advice were always appreciated by her friends.
meanings.sent5: The dispensations of gifts during the holiday season spread joy and cheer.

meanings.definition: a period of time in history marked by a particular set of beliefs or practices
meanings.sent1: The dispensations of the Middle Ages were characterized by feudalism and chivalry.
meanings.sent2: The dispensations of the Renaissance brought about a flourishing of art and culture.
meanings.sent3: In the future, people might look back at our dispensations and find them quaint.
meanings.sent4: The dispensations of the ancient civilizations continue to fascinate historians.
meanings.sent5: Studying the dispensations of the past helps us understand our present better.
